title: Are Democrats named after democracy? - Quora
tags: Democracy in the United States of America
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Yes, actually. They got their current name in Andrew Jackson’s time. They were originally called Republicans when they were founded by Thomas Jefferson. The modern Republican Party took over the Democrats’ old abandoned name when they got started in the 1850’s.

Yes. Both parties are named after broad principles of constitutional self rule. Parties named after more specific issues (Free Soil, Anti Masonic, Native American Party (aka the Know Nothings)) tend not to last very long.
